intro: Neolehmannia angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf lehmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Neolehmannia angustata produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
